name: practicably
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is practicable (= able to be done or put into action): practicably possible The government is advising people to leave the country as soon as is practicably possible. We do not understand how such a requirement could practicably be implemented.
More examplesFewer examplesThey argue that the search was unreasonable since the officers could practicably have obtained a search warrant.The websites were so slow they were practicably not usable. The new vehicle emission limits are not practicably enforceable.
